page.title: 05THORNDON COUNTRY PARK 2
page.content: The park is divided into two areas, the larger Forest area to the NW and the smaller open area around Octagonal Plantation in the SE.The two areas are connected by a footpath running alongside the Thorndon Hall Golf Course providing views of Hatch Farm and across the Thames Estuary Plain. Access to the park is either through the gates at Lion Lodge, off The Avenue, or from the slip road off Ingrave Road north of the Halfway House junction to the Arterial Road. There are many woodland walks, through mature deciduous and pine forest. Fishing is available in the Old Hall Pond and there are a number of picnic areas, especially in the southern part of the park where fresh water is available from free-standing taps, and barbecues can be set up too.
